alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 6:21PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Flood Advisory for... Southeastern Carbon County in south central Wyoming... Southwestern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 915 PM MDT. * At 618 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms impacting the Mullen Burn Scar. This will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. up to three quarters of an inch of rain has already fallen. Additional rainfall of one quarter inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. The Mullen Burn Scar west of Albany and southeast of Saratoga is the most likely place to experience minor flooding.
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains may trigger sudden rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
